meanings.definition: Not covered or concealed by curtains.
meanings.sent1: The room felt bright and open with the uncurtained windows.
meanings.sent2: The uncurtained window let in a lot of natural light.
meanings.sent3: The uncurtained window revealed a beautiful view of the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her uncurtained emotions were evident in her tear-streaked face.
meanings.sent5: The uncurtained truth was harsh but necessary to hear.

meanings.definition: To remove curtains from a window or other opening.
meanings.sent1: She uncurtained the windows to let in fresh air.
meanings.sent2: I uncurtained the stage to reveal the surprise behind.
meanings.sent3: The magician uncurtained the box to show it was empty.
meanings.sent4: He uncurtained the truth, exposing the lies beneath.
meanings.sent5: The artist uncurtained the masterpiece, stunning the audience.
